revised_title: Observations on Cinnabar and Gunpowder: Chemical Transformations and Expansion of Air
tldr: The author examines the chemical transformations of cinnabar and gunpowder through various experiments, observing the formation of new particles and the expansion of air upon combustion. The findings suggest that gunpowder's force is not solely dependent on the length of the cannon and that further improvements in shooting can be made by optimizing the composition of the material.
